metadata.title: CVE-2019-10195 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.description: A flaw was found in IPA, all 4.6.x versions before 4.6.7, all 4.7.xversions before 4.7.4 and all 4.8.x versions before 4.8.3, in the way thatFreeIPA's batch processing API logged operations. This included passinguser passwords in clear text on FreeIPA masters. Batch processing ofcommands with passwords as arguments or options is not performed by defaultin FreeIPA but is possible by third-party components. An attacker havingaccess to system logs on FreeIPA masters could use this flaw to produce logfile content with passwords exposed.

criterions.comment: freeipa: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
